polyrun

Class PolytopeRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • polyrun.PolytopeRunner

  • public class PolytopeRunner
extends Object
    Represents runner that can generates samples from a polytope using any RandomWalk.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PolytopeRunner(ConstraintsSystem constraintsSystem) 
      PolytopeRunner(ConstraintsSystem constraintsSystem, boolean removeRedundantConstraints, boolean skipZeroElements) 
      PolytopeRunner(ConstraintsSystem constraintsSystem, GLPSolver glpSolver, boolean skipZeroElements)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PolytopeRunner

        public PolytopeRunner(ConstraintsSystem constraintsSystem)
        Parameters:
        constraintsSystem - system of constraints

      • PolytopeRunner

        public PolytopeRunner(ConstraintsSystem constraintsSystem,
                      boolean removeRedundantConstraints,
                      boolean skipZeroElements)
        Parameters:
        constraintsSystem - system of constraints
        removeRedundantConstraints - whether to remove redundant constraints (after initial transformation) or not; use for better performance if there may be some redundant constrains
        skipZeroElements - whether RandomWalk should iterate over array of indices of non-zero elements or directly over entire transformed matrix A (from constraintsSystem)

      • PolytopeRunner

        public PolytopeRunner(ConstraintsSystem constraintsSystem,
                      GLPSolver glpSolver,
                      boolean skipZeroElements)
        Parameters:
        constraintsSystem - system of constraints
        glpSolver - solver; if not null redundant constrains will be removed; provide for better performance if there may be some redundant constrains
        skipZeroElements - whether RandomWalk should iterate over array of indices of non-zero elements or directly over entire transformed matrix A (from constraintsSystem)

    • Method Detail

      • chain

        public void chain(RandomWalk randomWalk,
                  ThinningFunction thinningFunction,
                  int numberOfSamples,
                  SampleConsumer consumer)
        Generates a chain of samples starting from startPoint. The method uses startPoint for storing next steps and finally startPoint is set to the last sample from the chain - to be a start point in next call of chain or neighborhood.
        Parameters:
        randomWalk - sampler
        thinningFunction - thinningFunction (see polyrun.thinning)
        numberOfSamples - number of samples
        consumer - samples consumer

      • neighborhood

        public void neighborhood(RandomWalk randomWalk,
                         int numberOfSamples,
                         SampleConsumer consumer)
        Generates samples from the neighborhood of startPoint. The method does not change startPoint.
        Parameters:
        randomWalk - sampler
        numberOfSamples - number of samples
        consumer - samples consumer

      • chain

        public double[][] chain(RandomWalk randomWalk,
                        ThinningFunction thinningFunction,
                        int numberOfSamples)
        Generates a chain of samples starting from startPoint. The method uses startPoint for storing next steps and finally it is set to the last sample from the chain to be a start point in next call of chain or neighborhood.
        Parameters:
        randomWalk - sampler
        thinningFunction - thinning function (see polyrun.thinning)
        numberOfSamples - number of samples
        Returns:
        array of generated samples

      • neighborhood

        public double[][] neighborhood(RandomWalk randomWalk,
                               int numberOfSamples)
        Generates samples from the neighborhood of startPoint. The method does not change startPoint.
        Parameters:
        randomWalk - sampler
        numberOfSamples - number of samples
        Returns:
        array of generated samples

      • setAnyStartPoint

        public void setAnyStartPoint()
                      throws UnboundedSystemException,
                             InfeasibleSystemException
        Sets start point for methods chain and neighborhood. Set point is calculated by slack maximization between edges.
        Throws:
        UnboundedSystemException - if a polytope is tried to be built on top of unbounded system of constraints (in such a case polytope cannot be sampled)
        InfeasibleSystemException - if a polytope is tried to be built on top of infeasible system of constraints (in such a case polytope cannot be sampled)

      • setAnyStartPoint

        public void setAnyStartPoint(GLPSolver glpSolver)
                      throws UnboundedSystemException,
                             InfeasibleSystemException
        Sets start point for methods chain and neighborhood. Set point is calculated by slack maximization between edges.
        Parameters:
        glpSolver - solver for General Linear Programing problem (e.g., CommonMathGLPSolverWrapper)
        Throws:
        UnboundedSystemException - if a polytope is tried to be build on top of unbounded system of constraints (in such a case polytope cannot be sampled)
        InfeasibleSystemException - if a polytope is tried to be build on top of infeasible system of constraints (in such a case polytope cannot be sampled)

      • setStartPoint

        public void setStartPoint(double[] startPoint)
        Sets start point for methods chain and neighborhood.
        Parameters:
        startPoint - point to be set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if a startPoint is not an interior point of the polytope

      • getStartPoint

        public double[] getStartPoint()
        Gets start point used as an initial point in methods chain and neighborhood.
        Returns:
        start point
